alert.note: Alert for Sheridan (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 30 at 5:12PM MDT until July 30 at 7:30PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE CRATER RIDGE BURN AREA REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN BIG HORN AND NORTHWESTERN SHERIDAN COUNTIES... At 512 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms have moved east of the the Crater Ridge Burn Area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in flash flooding and debris flows moving through the Pumpkin Creek, Mann Creek, West Fork Little Bighorn River, and the Little Bighorn River in the vicinity of the burn area. Roads impacted include Marble Quarry Road, Crater Ridge Springs Trail. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding and debris flows in and around the Crater Ridge Burn Area. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and downstream of the Crater Ridge Burn Area. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Crow Indian Reservation. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Crater Ridge Burn Area. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety. Remain alert for flooding of creeks, streams, and normally dry coulees even in areas not receiving rainfall downstream of the burn area. These can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes even from distant rainfall upstream. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
